name: Fab25 #inktober2021 "splat"
author: FabriceNeyret2
description:
[url]https://inktober.com/[/url]
#inktober2021 themes: [img]https://i.imgur.com/QjhAdpd.png[/img]
image_code:
#define H(p)      fract(sin((p)*mat2(127.1,311.7, 269.5,183.3)) *43758.5453123)
#define T(t,s)  ( t < 1. ? t-s : fract(t-s) )                   // init vs steady rain

void mainImage(out vec4 O, vec2 u ) 
{
    vec2  R = iResolution.xy;
    float N = 2., w = N/R.y, t = iTime/10.,
          l = 9., d,a;
    vec2  U = w* ( u+u - R ), D,P,_P,
          I = floor(U), F = fract(U)-.5;
          
    O = .9*texture(iChannel0, 2.*u/R);                          // background
    
    int i=-1,k=0;
    for( ; k < 9; k++ )                                         // check neighbor cells
        D = vec2( k%3, k/3 )-1.,
        T( t , H(I+D+.2).x ) > 0.                               // proba of splat
          ? P = F - D - H(I+D),
            d = dot(P,P),
            d < l ? l = d, _P=P,i=k : k :k;                     // keep closest splat id
        
    i >= 0
      ? a = atan(_P.y,_P.x),                                    // restore closest splat
        D = vec2( i%3, i/3 )-1.,
        F = H(I+D+.6)*.1, P = H(I+D+.4)*6.28,
        l = length(_P) - .1-F.x  -.03* cos(3.*a+P.x) -.03* (1.+3.*F.y)*cos(7.*a+P.y), // splat shape
        O = mix(O, vec4(.8,.8,1,1), .4* smoothstep(2.*min(fwidth(l),w),0., l )     // draw splat
                                      * smoothstep(1.,0.,T( t , H(I+D+.2).x ) ) )  // fade over time
      : O;
    
}

name: A Galaxy is Born - Interactive
author: Taytweets
image_code:
#define M iMouse
#define R iResolution
#define T iTime
#define pi 3.14


void mainImage(out vec4 fragColor,in vec2 fragCoord)

{vec2
m = ( iMouse.xy != vec2(0) ) ? M.xy/R.y*.5 : 5.5/vec2(100,100),
u=5.*m.xy*(gl_FragCoord.rg-R.rg/2.)/R.y;

float
d=pow(2./length(u),2.2),
t=.05*(T+5.*m.x),
i=floor(d-atan(u.g,u.r)/pi*2.),
a=atan(u.g,u.r)+pi/2.*i,
h=.002*a+5.2*t,
s=fract(a*1.2*t)<.1?3.:0.,
v=fract(a*t)>.1?3.:5.;


fragColor=vec4(sin(pi*2.*(h-vec3(1.,.888,.666))),1.);}

name: Figure8 logeps in s3

figure 8 uses complex number distance fields in s3.
This extreme distortion comes with extreme marching challenge.
a naive approach to that is logeps(), as in this shader.
a a smarter approach is to calculate the matrix of differentials to rescale lipschi

name: newton's fractal
author: thacks42
description:
simple implementation of newtons fractal
Fun fact: this works without evaluating the polynomial and its derivative.
Instead it relies on the logarithmic derivative of the polynomial.
The newton iteration step can thus be calculated directly from the roots

name: Circle-gradient
author: Taytweets
image_code:
#define M iMouse
#define R iResolution
#define T iTime
#define pi 3.14

void mainImage(out vec4 fragColor,in vec2 fragCoord)
{vec2 m = ( iMouse.xy != vec2(0) ) ? M.xy/R.y*.5 : .5+.5*vec2(cos(T),sin(T)),
u=25.*m.y*(gl_FragCoord.rg-R.rg/2.)/R.r;
float d=pow(2.*length(u),1.2),
t=.005*(T*15.*m.x),
i=floor(d-atan(u.g,u.r)/pi/2.+.8),
a=atan(u.g,u.r)+pi*2.*i,
h=.2*a+2.2*t,
s=fract(a*.5/t)<.5?1.:0.,
v=fract(a*.5/t)<1.5?0.:0.;
fragColor=vec4(vec3(v+s*v*5.5)*vec3(s/v)+cos(pi*2.*(h+vec3(1.,.888,.666))),1.);}

name: drapes 2
author: FabriceNeyret2
description:
Folds are modeled as circle sections of unit length curved to accommodate the target linear length.
See [url]https://www.desmos.com/calculator/umrflmd6dm[/url]

Mouse controls camera.
image_code:
#define rot(a)   mat2(cos(a+vec4(0,11,33,0)))                          // rotation
#define hue(v)  ( .6 + .6 * cos( 6.3*(v)  + vec4(0,23,21,0)  ) )

void mainImage(out vec4 O, vec2 U) 
{
    float t=9.,d, l,A,r,s,u,v;                           
    vec3  R = iResolution,
          D = normalize(vec3((U+U-R.xy)/R.y, -2.)),                    // ray direction
          p = vec3(0,-2,22), q,a,                                      // marching point along ray 
          M = iMouse.z > 0. ? iMouse.xyz/R -.5: vec3(10,12,0)/1e2*cos(.3*iTime+vec3(0,11,0))+vec3(0,.12,0); 

    for ( O=vec4(1); O.x > 0. && t > .005; O-=.005 )          
        q = p,
        q.yz *= rot(.5-6.3*M.y),                                       // rotations
        q.xz *= rot(-6.3*M.x), 
        a = abs(q), 
        v = .6 +.4*q.y/10.,                                            // normalized height
        l = mix(1., v, .5+.5*sin(iTime) ) -1e-3,     // drape extension: 1 = no folds,  0.2 = max folds
        u = floor(q.x/l),
        A = 1.1*acos(2.*l-1.) +2.*acos(l), r = 1./A, // folds angle & radius, see https://www.desmos.com/calculator/umrflmd6dm
        q.x = mod( q.x+l*float(q.z<0.) , 2.*l ) -l/2., 
        q.xz -= r * vec2( sin(A/2.),-sign(q.z)*cos(A/2.) ), 
        t = abs(length(q.xz) - r) -.01,
        t = max(t, max(a.x-10.*l,a.y-10.) ) ,

        p += .25*t*D;                                                  // step forward = dist to obj

    O *= .5+.5*texture(iChannel0,vec2(.5+.05*( u + fract(atan(q.x,abs(q.z))/A) ) , v )); // material
}

name: Fab21 #inktober2021 "fuzzy"
author: FabriceNeyret2
description:
[url]https://inktober.com/[/url]
#inktober2021 themes: [img]https://i.imgur.com/QjhAdpd.png[/img]

mouse controls camera
image_code:
#define rot(a)  mat2(cos(a+vec4(0,11,33,0)))                       // rotation

#define r  q.yz *= rot(.5-6.*M.y),                                 \
           q.xz *= rot(2.-6.*M.x)                                  \

#define C(l,w)  (                         /* rotated cube SDF */   \
        r,                                                         \
        a = abs(q)-(l),                                            \
        t = min(t, min(length(max(a.xy,a.xz)),length(max(a.xy,a.zy))) - (w) ) )

void mainImage(out vec4 O, vec2 U) 
{
    float t=9.,h=0.,b,c;                                           // b,c: hit object id 
    vec3  R = iResolution,
          D = normalize(vec3(U+U, -3.5*R.y) - R),                  // ray direction
          p = 9./R, q, a,                                          // marching point along ray 
          M = iMouse.z > 0. ? iMouse.xyz/R -.5: vec3(20,8,0)/1e2*cos(.3*iTime+vec3(0,11,0)); 
     
    for (c=1.; c > 0. && t > .01; c-=.01)                          // --- draw the fuzzy cube
        q = p, t = 9., 
        r, C( 1.2, -.05 ), h += exp(-t*t), 
        p += .5*t*D;                                               // step forward = dist to obj

    p = 9./R;
    for (O=vec4(1); O.x > 0. && t > .01; O-=.01)                   // --- draw the sharp cubes
        q = p, 
        c = C( 1.5, .04 ),
        r,                                                         // ( frame of the fuzzy cube )
        b = C( .8 , .03 ), 
        p += .2*t*D;                                               // step forward = dist to obj

  O *= 1.5; t==c ? O *= vec4(.8,.9,1,1) : t==b ? O *= vec4(1,.9,.8,1) : O; // color scheme
  O = max( O, .04*h*vec4(.8,1,.8,1) );                             // combine sharp + fuzzy
}

           float s=sin(iTime),c=cos(iTime
         ),n=1.-c,o=.7,k=o*o;vec4 D=mat4(n
       *k+c,n*k,o*s,0,n*k,n*k+c,-o*s,0,-o*s,
     o*s,c,0,0,0,0,0)*vec4(p+vec3(0,0,-4),1);
    return length(vec2(length(D.xz)-1.,D.y))-.4
   ;}void mainImage(out vec4 O,in vec2 I){vec2 R
   =iResolution.xy,u=(I.xy-vec2((R.x-R.y)*.5,0))
  /R.y*45.;/**/vec3 d=       normalize(vec3(floor
  (u)/45.-.5,1)),C =           vec3(0);for(int i=
  0;i<15;++i){C+=d*G           (C);}float D= max(
  dot(normalize((vec3          (G(C+vec3(.1,0,0))
  ,G(C+vec3(0,.1,0))           ,G(C+vec3(0,0,.1))
  )-G(C))/.1),normalize     (-C)),.0); ivec2 b =
   ivec2(floor(fract(u)*7.8))-(1,0);O=vec4(vec3(
   length(C)<9.&&b.x>=0&&b.x<=4&&b.y>=0&&b.y<=6
    &&/*#*/(int[13](0,0x40000,0xc0000,0x810200,
    0x41038104, 0x28000, 0x3428000, 0x1428500,

         ,0xf55b305f)[int(D*13.)]&1<<int(b
           .x*7+(6-b.y)-1))>0?D:0.),1);}

name: Fab22 #inktober2021 "open"
author: FabriceNeyret2
description:
[url]https://inktober.com/[/url]
#inktober2021 themes: [img]https://i.imgur.com/QjhAdpd.png[/img]

mouse controls camera.    line #18. try l / D distance of opening.
Some artifacts remaining.
image_code:
#define rot(a)  mat2(cos(a+vec4(0,11,33,0)))                       // rotation
#define door    max( a.x-1.,max(a.y-2.,a.z-.05))

void mainImage(out vec4 O, vec2 U) 
{
    float t=9.,h=0.,l, T=2.*iTime,d,f,k;                           // d,f,k: hit object id 
    vec3  R = iResolution,
          D = normalize(vec3((U+U-R.xy)/R.y, -1.5)),               // ray direction
          p = vec3(0,1,0), q, a,qd,                                // marching point along ray 
          M = iMouse.z > 0. ? iMouse.xyz/R -.5: vec3(2,.1,0)/1e2*cos(1.3*T+vec3(0,11,0))+vec3(0,.05,0); 

    for ( O=vec4(1); O.x > 0. && t > .01; O-=.005 )                // --- draw the sharp cubes
        q = p,
        q.yz *= rot(.5-6.3*M.y), 
        q.xz *= rot(-6.3*M.x),
        q.z -= T, l = floor(q.z/3.+.8)*3.-1.+T,  // ( thanks to spalmer for the debug ! )
        q.z = mod(q.z+1.8,3.) - 1.8,
        a = q, a.x++, a.xz *= rot( -2.*smoothstep(-1.,0.,l/3.+.5) ), a.x--, // --- doors
        qd= a, a = abs(a), t = d = door,
        t = min(t, k = length(qd - vec3(.8,.1,.1))-.1),            // door knob
        q.z = abs(q.z)-.02,                                        // --- walls
        a = abs(q), 
        t = min(t, max( min( q.z, f= q.y+2.),                      // wall+floor
                       -door ) ),                                  // door hole
        p += .25*t*D;                                              // step forward = dist to obj
        
                                                                   // --- materials
    O *= t==d ? texture(iChannel2,qd.yx) // vec4(.6,.3,.1,1);      // doors
       : t==k ? vec4(.7,.6,0,1) + 1e2*pow(.58*(qd.x+qd.y+qd.z),15.)// knob
       : t==f ? texture(iChannel0,q.xz ) // * vec4(.2,.2,.5,1);    // floor
       :        texture(iChannel1,q.xy )*.2+.8;                    // walls
}

image_code:
#define M iMouse
#define R iResolution
#define T iTime
#define pi 3.14

void mainImage(out vec4 fragColor,in vec2 fragCoord)

{vec2 m = ( iMouse.xy != vec2(0) ) ? M.xy/R.y*.5 : 5.5/vec2(10,10),
u=50.*m.y*(gl_FragCoord.rg-R.rg/2.)/R.r;

float 
d=pow(2.*length(u),1.2),
t=.005*(T*5.*m.x),
i=floor(d-atan(u.g,u.r)/pi/2.+.5),
a=atan(u.g,u.r)+pi*2.*i,
h=.002*a+5.5*t,
s=fract(a*.2*t)<.5?1.:0.,
v=fract(a+t)<.5?0.:1.;

fragColor=vec4(vec3(v+s*v*.5)*+sin(pi*2.*(h+vec3(1.,.888,.666))),1.);}
